Class Rand

    Some random lottery utilities.
    Author:
    Amir

      • randomInRange

        public static float randomInRange(float max,
                  java.util.Random rand)
        Returns a random floating point number between 0 and max.
        Parameters:
        max - maximal range of the float this method returns.
        rand - a Random object for this lottery.
        Returns:
        a random floating point number between 0 and max.

      • randomInRange

                  float max,

        Returns a random floating point number between min and max.

        min - minimal range of the float this method returns.

        Returns:

      • randomIntRounded

        public static int randomIntRounded(float middle,
                   java.util.Random rand)
        Returns a probabilistic integer based on a floating point number. If the number is an integer it will always be returned. If, for example, it is 1.2, 2 will be drawn 20% of the time and 1 80% of it.
        Parameters:
        middle - the float to draw the value from.
        rand - a Random object.
        Returns:
        a random integer between floor(middle) and ceil(middle) with appropriate probabilities.

      • randomIntRoundedWithErrorCorrection

        public static int randomIntRoundedWithErrorCorrection(float middle,
                                      float effective,
                                      java.util.Random rand)
        Returns a probabilistic integer like the last method, but accounting for errors to that after a high value is rolled there will be a greater chance for a lower number in the next roll, and vice versa. The way to do this is to add an affective middle value and to substract from it the error (returned_value-middle) of every roll.
        Parameters:
        middle - he float to draw the value from.
        effective - a value to balance the probabilities with. When it's smaller, there's a larger change for the higher integer. For the first call make it NaN.
        rand - a Random object.
        Returns:
        a random integer between floor(middle) and ceil(middle) with appropriate probabilities.
